lily_cooking.speaker: Narrator
lily_cooking.text: You find Lily in your kitchen, cooking with a freedom you've never seen in her before. She hums softly as she works, occasionally adjusting seasonings by instinct rather than measurement.

lily_joy.speaker: Lily
lily_joy.text: *She notices you and beams - a genuine, warm smile* Watch this. I'm making my old Gourmet Special, but I'm improvising. I added a touch of honey because it felt right. Can you imagine? Felt!

lily_new_dish.speaker: Lily
lily_new_dish.text: *She plates the dish with care, but not obsessive precision* I've decided to create something new. A dish that celebrates imperfection. I'm calling it 'The Happy Accident.'

lily_gift.speaker: Lily
lily_gift.text: But first... I want to share something with you. My old secret recipe - the souffl√© I spent five years perfecting. I've never shared it with anyone.

lily_explain_gift.speaker: Lily
lily_explain_gift.text: *She pulls out a handwritten recipe card, worn at the edges* This recipe was my prison. Every failed attempt felt like personal failure. But now... it can be a gift instead.

player_receive_recipe.speaker: Narrator
player_receive_recipe.text: Lily offers you her treasured recipe.

choices.text: I'm honored, Lily. I'll add my own twist to it.
Are you sure? This means so much to you.

lily_delighted.speaker: Lily
lily_delighted.text: *She laughs* Yes! Make it yours. Ruin it beautifully. That's the whole point now, isn't it? The old Lily would be horrified. The new Lily can't wait to taste your version.

lily_certain.speaker: Lily
lily_certain.text: I've never been more certain of anything. This recipe deserves to be in a kitchen where it will be loved, not feared. Your kitchen is that place.

lily_friendship.speaker: Lily
lily_friendship.text: You know, I came here to judge. To feel superior. Instead, I found something I'd lost - my love of cooking. And a friend who showed me the way back.

lily_final.speaker: Lily
lily_final.text: *She raises her spoon like a toast* To Dragon Haven Cafe - where perfection goes to die, and something better takes its place.
